duties_responsibilities.duty: Collect and author change controls for components and raw materials by obtaining details from cross-functional departments.
Enter change controls into electronic system (QTS) and route to departments for assessments.
Track and project manage the assessment completion, approvals, and associated task completion.
Enroll new tasks into electronic system (QTS), assign task owners, and extend due dates when needed.
Adhere to site SOPs and cGMPs for production activities in the manufacturing facilities and enforce safety standards.
Participate in routine safety training events and enforce safety and biosafety requirements as they relate to the department.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in a scientific or engineering discipline, with minimum 1-2 years GMP experience. Knowledge of pharmaceutical supply chain preferred.
